result.execSummary:
The defendant Laquandis C Gibson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Laquandis C Gibson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Laquandis C Gibson was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: 2nd/Sub. Drug Off.-Class E/F/G/H/I Fel., Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.
